Bicycle: One of the most eco-friendly and healthy ways to travel long distances is by bicycle. It's a great option for those who enjoy cycling and can cover a considerable distance in a day.
Electric scooter: Electric scooters are becoming increasingly popular as a mode of transportation. They are easy to handle, require no license, and can cover a considerable distance in a day.
Walking: Walking is a great way to explore new places and get some exercise at the same time. It may take longer than other modes of transportation, but it's free and doesn't require any fuel.

Carpooling: If all public transport stops working, carpooling could be a viable option. It allows people to share the cost and responsibility of driving, and can be an efficient way to travel long distances.

Boat or Ferry: Depending on the location, taking a boat or ferry could be a great way to travel long distances. It's a scenic and relaxing way to travel, and can be a great option for those who enjoy water sports or fishing.
